content: handmade with love stitchwizardry and just a touch of magic stitchcraft_and_wizardry stitchcraftandwizardryperth@gmail com waffle stitch dishcloth yarn 8 ply 100% cotton needles/hook 3 75mm gauge 24 st / 10 row = 10cm x 10cm measurements 17cm x 17cm notions tapestry needle scissors this pattern uses the us standard crochet abbreviations chain chain double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet fpdc front post double_crochet these dishcloths are created using the waffle stitch which is one of my favourite stitches to use when i want a rough texture which is definitely something you want when trying to scrub your lovely munchkin s 7 day old plate that had been hiding under their bed in their room you can alter the size of this pattern by simply adding more chains at the beginning and more row as you work through the pattern until you have reached the size you like you will need to add multiples of 3 i hope you enjoy this pattern as much as i do if you have any problems or would like to get in touch please contact me through ravelry or by any of the means above in the header  happy hooking 1 handmade with love stitchwizardry and just a touch of magic stitchcraft_and_wizardry stitchcraftandwizardryperth@gmail com pattern directions chain 30 + 4 row 1 double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook double_crochet in every chain to the end chain 1 and turn i like to pull my hook out of the loop and turn the stitch around to untwist the yarn after my turn as i feel it makes a nicer finish this is a personal preference however and is completely optional row 2 double_crochet in 1st stitch directly under your turning chain fpdc in 2nd stitch *double_crochet in next 2 stitches fpdc in next stitch* *repeat 9 times double_crochet in last stitch double_crochet in the chain 1 of your last row this will create a very straight and neat edge chain 1 and turn 2 handmade with love stitchwizardry and just a touch of magic stitchcraft_and_wizardry stitchcraftandwizardryperth@gmail com row 3 double_crochet in 1st stitch directly under your turning chain double_crochet in next stitch *fpdc in next 2 stitches these should be the ones standing to the front a little already double_crochet in next stitch* *repeat 9 times double_crochet in last stitch double_crochet in the chain 1 of your last row chain 1 and turn repeat row 2 and 3 until you have reached the desired length once you have reached your desired length you can place an optional border around the cloth i like to do this as it straightens out the edges and finishes it off nicely if you decide not to have a border just cut the yarn now and weave in your ends optional border do not cut your yarn after the last row turn your work sideways and start to single_crochet around the
